summary: John has demonstrated significant and inconsistent adherence to his diabetes management plan. Initially, he experienced elevated glucose after consuming cake at a party, expressing disappointment but acknowledging social difficulties. Despite an initial commitment to his meal plan and exercise, subsequent higher glucose readings indicated a lapse. John attributed this non-adherence, including neglecting walks and consuming "quick things to eat," to a stressful work week, citing lack of time and energy. A major contributing factor to a glucose spike (up to 250 mg/dL) was his admission of forgetting his insulin dose before breakfast, which he stated occurred because he was "in a rush." While John expresses awareness of his mistakes and frustration, his engagement in exploring proactive solutions, such as quick meal options or home exercises, remained low, often with vague or non-committal responses. Overall, consistent adherence to medication, diet, and exercise routines remains a challenge for John, particularly when influenced by external stressors.
